fact: Pike Place Market is the oldest continuously operating farmerâ€™s market in the country.
The Seattle Seahawks have played in the city since 1976.
Seattle has the highest per capita coffee consumption in the United States.
The Wing Luke Museum of the Asian Pacific American Experience commemorates the contributions of Chinese, Japanese, and other Asian peoples to the history, politics, and culture of the region.
Seattle was the birthplace and childhood home of the legendary rock guitarist Jimi Hendrix.
Seattle gave rise to the grunge sound of the early 1990s, exemplified by such bands as Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, and Mudhoney.
The city has many annual cultural events, like the Folklife Festival, the Earshot Jazz Festival, and Bumbershoot.
Woodland Park, once a private estate on Green Lake that now houses a zoo, ball fields, picnic grounds, and a large rose garden.
Outdoor activities in and around Seattle include hiking, rock climbing, skiing, snowboarding, boating, and fishing.
Seattle was the home of the SuperSonics of the NBA from 1967 to 2008, when the team was relocated to Oklahoma City.
